intro: Talisia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf talisia, is a woody shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Talisia stricta typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
